com.aloqa.trax.client
Class TraXClient

java.lang.Object
  com.aloqa.trax.client.TraXClient
Direct Known Subclasses:
AndroidTraXClient, J2SETraXClient
public class TraXClient
extends java.lang.Object

Use this class to connect to and access the Aloqa location services. The Aloqa location services are subsumed under the label TraX, which stands for Tracking and X-change. TraX has started as a university project at the LMU Munich and is now being further developed and marketed by Aloqa. Basically, the TraXClient connects by standard network services to the Aloqa server and transmits its position when needed. Via the Aloqa server, users can track each other's position. Also, users can be notified about spatial events concerning other users. For example, a user can be notified when another user enters or leaves a specific geographical zone. Another example is proximity detection between a pair of users, which notifies a user as soon as two users approach each other below a certain proximity distance.
This class is based on a J2ME connection library. If you want to use a connection library of a different platform, e.g., J2SE, Android, Blackberry, then use the TraXClients J2SETraXClient, AndroidTraXClient, ...
For necessary clean-up tasks, do not forget to call the shutdown()-method prior to exiting the application.

Constructor Summary

          Creates an instance of TraXClient, using J2ME libraries.

          Creates an instance of TraXClient, using J2ME connections libraries and a custom PositionProviderFactory for positioning.
 
Method Summary
 Connection_SAP_Target getConnection_SAP_Target()
          Returns a reference to the Connection_SAP_Target - interface, which is used to control the connection parameters and its current status.
 HandleManager getHandleManager()
          Returns a reference to the HandleManager, which is used to obtain a TraXHandle, which, in turn, is needed to access the TraXAPI_SAP_App - interface.
 LLPM_SAP_Target getLLPM_SAP_Target()
          Returns a reference to the LLPM_SAP_Target - interface, which is used to control the local positioning procedure.

 void setApp_SAP_App(App_SAP_App app)
          Sets the App_SAP_App interface for handling proactive push-messages from a remote application (either mobile or at the server-side).
 void setStatusListener(TraXStatusListener l)
          Sets a TraXStatusListener that is notified about all important TraX-events such as the availability of position sources or getting connected and disconnected.

Constructor Detail

TraXClient

public TraXClient(java.lang.String applicationId,
                  java.lang.String userId)
Creates an instance of TraXClient, using J2ME libraries. For positioning the Location API for J2ME (JSR 179) is used. If the JSR 179 is not available at your targeted platform, use the TraXClient(String, String, PositionProviderFactory) - constructor and specify a custom PositionProviderFactory.

Parameters:
applicationId - A String that identifies the application with the Aloqa location server. Check http://dev.aloqa.com for information on how to obtain a valid application id.
userId - A String that identifies this user within the application.

TraXClient

public TraXClient(java.lang.String applicationId,
                  java.lang.String userId,
                  PositionProviderFactory posFac)
Creates an instance of TraXClient, using J2ME connections libraries and a custom PositionProviderFactory for positioning.

Parameters:
applicationId - A String that identifies the application with the Aloqa location server. Check http://dev.aloqa.com for information on how to obtain a valid application id.
userId - A String that identifies the user within the application.
posFac - A custom PositionProviderFactory that can create a PositionProvider used for positioning.
Method Detail

getConnection_SAP_Target

public Connection_SAP_Target getConnection_SAP_Target()
Returns a reference to the Connection_SAP_Target - interface, which is used to control the connection parameters and its current status.

Returns:
A reference to the Connection_SAP_Target.

getHandleManager

public HandleManager getHandleManager()
Returns a reference to the HandleManager, which is used to obtain a TraXHandle, which, in turn, is needed to access the TraXAPI_SAP_App - interface.

Returns:
A reference to the HandleManager.

public LLPM_SAP_Target getLLPM_SAP_Target()
Returns a reference to the LLPM_SAP_Target - interface, which is used to control the local positioning procedure.

Returns:
A reference to the LLPM_SAP_Target.

Gets the current TraXStatus.

Returns:
The current TraXStatus.

getTraXAPI_SAP_App

public TraXAPI_SAP_App getTraXAPI_SAP_App()
Returns a reference to the TraXAPI_SAP_App - interface, which is used to access the Aloqa location services.

Returns:
A reference to the TraXAPI_SAP_App.

setApp_SAP_App

public void setApp_SAP_App(App_SAP_App app)
Sets the App_SAP_App interface for handling proactive push-messages from a remote application (either mobile or at the server-side).

Parameters:
app - The App_SAP_App - object to be notified about push messages.
See Also:
NotificationRequest, NotificationResponse

setStatusListener

public void setStatusListener(TraXStatusListener l)
Sets a TraXStatusListener that is notified about all important TraX-events such as the availability of position sources or getting connected and disconnected.

shutdown

public void shutdown()
Cleans up system ressources. Always invoke this method prior to exiting from the application.
